products_tools.name: Passion Fruit
products_tools.use_case: Creator sponsorship marketplace with ready-to-go sponsorship packages

business_strategies.strategy: Build 40+ SEO-optimized mini tools to drive traffic
business_strategies.implementation: Create more than one mini tool per month, all SEO optimized for long-tail keywords
business_strategies.expected_results: 70% of total traffic from mini tools combined
business_strategies.case_study: Speaker built 40+ mini tools that collectively drove 70% of traffic

business_strategies.strategy: Use free mini tools to sell main product
business_strategies.implementation: Build SEO-optimized free tools that rank for long-tail keywords, then sell main product to users
business_strategies.expected_results: Significant traffic generation for main product sales
business_strategies.case_study: Mini tools strategy drove 70% of traffic for main product

problems_solutions.problem: Brands struggle to find and vet quality creators for sponsorships
problems_solutions.solution: Create AI-powered curation and moderation system for creator applications

startup_ideas.idea: Reverse marketplace - Link tree for brands instead of creators
startup_ideas.target_market: Brands wanting creator partnerships and creators seeking sponsorships
startup_ideas.problem_solved: Brands missing out on good creators, creators struggling to find relevant brand partnerships
startup_ideas.business_model: Take a percentage cut on sponsorship deals
startup_ideas.validation: Tweet Hunter's sponsorship page received hundreds of applications when announced

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Assuming a market space is completely saturated
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Missing opportunities for innovation in seemingly crowded markets
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Look deeper into market gaps and new approaches even in saturated spaces
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Speaker initially thought brand-influencer matching was 100% saturated in 2015, but new innovations like Passion Fruit proved otherwise
